# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's how you can do that in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")  # Split the string into words
    lines = []                # Initialize an empty list for lines

    line = ""                 # Start a new line with no content

    for word in words         # Iterate over each word
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width   # If adding this word would exceed the width
            push!(lines, line)  # Push the current line to the list of lines and start a new one
            line = ""           # Start a new line with no content
        end

        line *= " $word"      # Add the word to the current line
    end

    push!(lines, line)  # Push the last line (after the loop has finished) to the list of lines
    
    return join(lines, "\n")   # Join all the lines together with new lines and return them as a string
end
```

For example:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet"
println(wrap_string(str))
```

Outputs:

```text
Lorem 
ipsum 
dolor 
sit 
amet
```
